eu_initiatives:
ARCADIS is the leading global natural and built asset design and consultancy firm working in partnership with our clients to deliver exceptional and sustainable outcomes through the application of design, consultancy, engineering, project and management services. 
ARCADIS follows the EU (but also other regions and continents) initiatives , policies and legislative files relating to engineering, watermanagement, environment, infrastructure and architecture. ARCADIS does this to ensure that it acts in compliance with all relevant (local and EU) laws and regulations while performing its activities/work. 
 
Please note that ARCADIS is awarded with assignments as a result of participating in tender processes. ARCADIS does not acquire work/assignments as a result of lobbying activities.

relevant_communication:
ARCADIS is involved in several projects for the EU. 
 
Please note that ARCADIS is awarded with assignments as a result of participating in tender processes. ARCADIS does not acquire work/assignments as a result of lobbying activities. 
 
As an indication, here are two projects for the EU that ARCADIS is involved in: 
 
- BRM advice RESIN (a Horizon 2020 project) - Climate resilient cities and infrastructures. Project duration is approx.. 3 years. It is a consortium of 15 other parties (most of them research institutes and cities). Contract type: Grant agreement with consortium, plus consortium agreement according to EC standard agreement (DESCA model). Governing law: laws of Belgium. Project is financed by European Commission (Horizon 2020 project).  
 
- Subsol - Water Freshkeeper (a Horizon 2020 project).  
Project partner is KWR Watercycle Research Institute (named SUBSOL). Aim: finding smart solution for preventing salinization of groundwater.  
Project duration is 3 years. It is a consortium of other parties.
